response.content:
{
  "step1": "Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease two 9‑inch round cake pans with butter, then lightly dust with flour, tapping out excess. In a large bowl, whisk together 2 ½ cups all‑purpose flour, 2 ½ teaspoons baking powder, ½ teaspoon baking soda, and ½ teaspoon salt for balanced flavor and texture. Ready.",
  "step2": "Combine wet ingredients in a separate mixing bowl: beat 1 cup softened butter until creamy, then add 2 cups granulated sugar, whisking until fluffy. Incorporate 4 large eggs one at a time, followed by 2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract, mixing thoroughly after each addition to ensure smooth consistency throughout the.",
  "step3": "Gradually add the dry flour mixture to the butter mixture, mixing on low speed until just combined. Pour in 1 cup unsweetened cocoa powder, 1 cup buttermilk, and ½ cup hot water, stirring gently to create a glossy, thick batter without overmixing, preserving tenderness for optimal rise and moisture. Enjoy.",
  "step4": "Divide the batter evenly between the prepared pans, smoothing tops with a spatula. Tap the pans lightly on the counter to release any trapped air bubbles. Place them in the preheated oven, baking for 30‑35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center emerges clean and golden brown color.",
  "step5": "Remove the cakes from the oven, allowing them to cool in the pans for ten minutes. Then run a thin knife around the edges, invert onto a wire rack, and peel off parchment. Let the layers cool completely before frosting, ensuring the surface is dry for a smooth finish today.",
  "step6": "Prepare the chocolate frosting: melt ½ cup butter, ¾ cup dark chocolate, and ¼ cup cream together over low heat. Whisk in 2 cups powdered sugar and a pinch of salt until silky. Spread frosting generously between layers, over the top, and around the sides, then chill briefly before serving."
}
